alert.note: Alert for Dunn (North Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 11 at 9:39AM CDT until April 12 at 8:30AM CDT by NWS Bismarck
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Bismarck ND has issued a Flood Warning for the Knife River at Manning affecting Dunn County in North Dakota... ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS AFTERNOON TO TOMORROW MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Knife River at Manning. * WHEN...From this afternoon to tomorrow morning. * IMPACTS...A flood of 14.89 ft created problems and required sandbagging of rural homes in 2009. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:00 AM CDT Tuesday /7:00 AM MDT Tuesday/ the stage was 14.7 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage this afternoon to a crest of 15.1 feet. It will then fall below flood stage later this evening. - Flood stage is 15.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 15.1 feet on 05/22/2011. &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
